ivardefs.name: additiveProductName
ivardefs.desc: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.

ivardefs.name: additiveType
ivardefs.desc: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

ivardefs.name: administrationInstruction
ivardefs.desc: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.

ivardefs.name: administration_
ivardefs.desc: Formula administration instructions as structured data.  This repeating structure allows for changing the administration rate or volume over time for both bolus and continuous feeding.  An example of this would be an instruction to increase the rate of co

ivardefs.name: baseFormulaProductName
ivardefs.desc: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".

ivardefs.name: baseFormulaType
ivardefs.desc: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

ivardefs.name: caloricDensity
ivardefs.desc: The amount of energy (calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz.  For example, an infant may require a formula that provides 24 calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that pro

ivardefs.name: maxVolumeToDeliver
ivardefs.desc: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1440 mL over 24 hours.

ivardefs.name: routeofAdministration
ivardefs.desc: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient's gastrointestinal  tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g. nasogastric tube.

properties.desc: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.
